statement.title: # Content
statement.content: There is an array $A$ with length of $n$. $A\_i (1 \leq A\_i \leq m)$ is the $i\_{th}$ element in $A$. Please find a possible situation of $A$ so that the inversion number is exactly $K$.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content:
Only three integers  indicating $n$, $m$, $k$.

$ 1 \leq m \leq n \leq 1000, 1 \leq k \leq 1000000$

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content: $n$ numbers in a line indicating $A$ if there is a solution, If there are multiple solutions, you may print any of them. Otherwise output `-1` instead.

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
5 3 21 1 2 1 1
